author: Святенко Тамара
title: Ukrainians warned about possible power outages due to cold weather when schedules will return
text: Ukrainians warned about possible power outages due to cold weather: when schedules will return. In Ukraine, electricity might be turned off again according to the schedule due to worsening weather conditions. This was stated by a member of the supervisory board of "Centrenergo" Volodymyr Velychko. According to him, weather forecasters predict a drop in temperature from next week, which will require the application of more significant measures to balance the energy system. If unsuccessful in this matter, it will be necessary to introduce power outage schedules. The peak electricity consumption has already shifted to 19:10 due to the temperature drop. Velychko also emphasized the possible increase in electricity prices due to increased consumption in Europe and the decrease in the share of renewable energy sources. Currently, "Centrenergo" is continuing repair work at its own power plants to provide an additional capacity of almost 1 GW. However, the chairman of the company's supervisory board and the general director refuted Velychko's statement and noted that the determination of outage schedules is the competence of NEC "Ukrenergo", and Velychko's opinion does not reflect the company's position. The situation in the energy system is currently stable. Also, we remind you: Lithuania will dismantle power lines connecting it with Russia and Belarus. Read also [Ukraine prepares roadmaps for negotiation chapters on EU accession](https://112.ua/en/ukraina-gotue-dorozni-karti-za-glavami-peregovoriv-pro-vstup-iz-es-45081)[Threats from China to the US: What Trump and Harris Say](https://112.ua/en/zagrozi-kitau-dla-ssa-so-govorat-tramp-i-garris-45085)[Another country has joined the coalition for the return of Ukrainian children from the Russian Federation](https://112.ua/en/do-koalicii-za-povernenna-ukrainskih-ditej-z-rf-priednalasa-se-odna-kraina-45086)[Pyshnyi explained how the risk of hryvnia issuance was reduced](https://112.ua/en/pisnij-poasniv-ak-vdalosa-zniziti-rizik-emisii-grivni-45067)[Political Scientist Assessed the Probability of Poland Being Allowed to Shoot Down Missiles Over Ukraine](https://112.ua/en/politolog-ociniv-virogidnist-dozvolu-polsi-zbivati-raketi-nad-ukrainou-45068)[Military analyst explained why Putin is involving North Korean troops in the war against Ukraine](https://112.ua/en/vijskovij-analitik-poasniv-comu-putin-zalucae-vijska-kndr-na-vijnu-proti-ukraini-45073)

author: @Care2
title: Kick the insurrectionist and drunk Republicans off the House Intel Committee!
text:
Speaker Mike Johnson has made the astonishing decision to add Reps. Scott Perry of Pennsylvania and Ronny Jackson of Texas to the vitally important House Intelligence Committee.
Perry is an avowed insurrectionist who was at the center of Donald Trump's failed plan to replace the acting Attorney General with one who would enable his plot to steal the 2020 election; Ronny Jackson is a bumbling idiot whose biggest claim to fame is getting demoted by the Pentagon for getting drunk, popping pills, and sexually harassing his coworkers.
Neither of these men should be ANYWHERE near the House Intelligence Committee.
Demand Speaker Johnson remove these bozos from House Intel!
This is a clear handout to Trump and the far-right that threatens our national security — not to mention disgracing the committee itself. Former GOP rep Adam Kinzinger decried the move as "insane" while Rep. Mikie Sherill warned these men would "weaponize the Intel Committee to support Trump's agenda."
We cannot allow an unrepentant traitor and drunken lunatic like Perry and Jackson remain on the House Intel Committee.
Kick the insurrectionist and drunk Republicans off the House Intel Committee!

author: La Rédaction Maison & Travaux
title: Pourquoi vous ne devriez jamais mettre de magnets sur votre frigo
text:
Utilisez-vous des magnets pour embellir la porte de votre frigo ? Il faut savoir que ce n'est pas recommandé. Bien qu'ils ajoutent une touche de couleur à la porte souvent terne des frigos, ces petits objets peuvent en réalité causer des dommages irréversibles. Voici pourquoi il est conseillé de les retirer rapidement.
Le champ magnétique, un danger caché pour votre frigo
Les aimants produisent un champ magnétique qui peut interférer avec le bon fonctionnement des frigos modernes. Ces appareils sont souvent dotés de technologies sensibles, telles que des écrans tactiles ou des commandes électroniques. Placer des aimants sur ces frigos peut donc endommager ces composants fragiles.
Des recherches indiquent que les champs magnétiques générés par les aimants décoratifs peuvent provoquer des dysfonctionnements. « Déposer des aimants sur la porte du frigo va créer un champ magnétostatique qui risque d’endommager l’appareil », avertit Marie-France. De nombreux fabricants confirment ce danger, soulignant que les champs magnétiques peuvent accélérer la dégradation de ces technologies.
Les aimants ne posent pas de problème pour les anciens frigos
Pour les frigos plus anciens, « aucun dispositif sensible aux champs magnétiques n'est présent », explique sur le forum Quora, le docteur Didier Perret de la section de chimie et de biochimie de l’Université de Genève (Suisse). Ces appareils fonctionnent sur le principe des pompes à chaleur et ne sont pas affectés par les petits aimants décoratifs. Les petits aimants que l'on affiche sur le frigo ne sont donc pas assez puissants pour perturber leur bon fonctionnement.
De plus, des tests simples, comme poser un trombone de l'autre côté d'une porte chargée de magnets, montrent que les aimants décoratifs n'ont pas la puissance suffisante pour atteindre les parties internes des anciens modèles. Essayez de faire tenir un magnet sur la partie intérieure d'une porte pleine de magnets et vous verrez qu'il ne colle pas.
Pourquoi il faut éviter les magnets sur les frigos modernes ?
Les frigos modernes sont équipés de technologies de pointe et de composants électroniques sophistiqués. Contrairement aux anciens modèles, ces appareils sont vulnérables aux champs magnétiques créés par les aimants décoratifs. En 2021, Apple a précisé que « les aimants et champs électromagnétiques peuvent interférer avec des appareils médicaux », rappelle Ouest France. Ce principe s'applique également aux réfrigérateurs modernes.
Ainsi, les fabricants recommandent de limiter l’utilisation des aimants sur ces appareils pour éviter tout risque de dommage. En effet, même les aimants les plus faibles peuvent à terme perturber les circuits électroniques des frigos modernes, causant des dysfonctionnements. Pour protéger votre appareil, évitez cette erreur dès maintenant !

author: JACKSON WALKER | The National News Desk
title: chevron-right
text:
WASHINGTON (TNND) — Vice President JD Vance on Tuesday called out Sen. Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., for voting against the Trump administration’s nominee for a top Pentagon position.
Sen. McConnell voted against the confirmation of Elbridge Colby, President Donald Trump’s nominee to serve as under secretary of defense for policy. In a statement on his decision, the senator explained Trump’s selection could prove hazardous to the nation.
“Mr. Colby’s confirmation leaves open the door for the less-polished standard-bearers of restraint and retrenchment at the Pentagon to do irreparable damage to the system of alliances and partnerships which serve as force multipliers to U.S. leadership,” he wrote. “It encourages isolationist perversions of peace through strength to continue apace at the highest levels of Administration policymaking.”
“Make no mistake,” the senator added. “America will not be made great again by those who are content to manage our decline.”
Taking to X, the vice president fired back at Sen. McConnell for opposing the Trump administration.
“Mitch’s vote today—like so much of the last few years of his career—is one of the great acts of political pettiness I’ve ever seen,” he fumed.
Reacting to the post was Rep. Mike Collins, R-Ga., who said “glad things are changing.”
Sen. McConnell, 83, has already decided not to seek reelection in 2026, marking the end of his lengthy congressional career. The senator in February fell twice at the Capitol, causing him to use a wheelchair as a precaution.
Follow Jackson Walker on X at @_jlwalker_ for the latest trending national news. Have a news tip? Send it to jacwalker@sbgtv.com.
